snippet: The tour of Mexico by Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has some of the trappings of a presidential campaign, with local traffic stopping for his motorcade, with aides enforcing protocol and with efforts to put the governor in the best possible...
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's three-day trip to Mexico seems like a dress rehearsal for the presidential campaign he is still debating whether to undertake, offering an early glimpse of what a large-scale Christie-style political operation might look like; campaign-like air, including motorcades and TV-ready quality of scheduling, pervades his visit.
lead_paragraph: The tour of Mexico by Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has some of the trappings of a presidential campaign, with local traffic stopping for his motorcade, with aides enforcing protocol and with efforts to put the governor in the best possible light.

headline.main: Christie’s Trip Looks Like a Campaign for President
headline.print_headline: Christie’s Trip Looks Like a Campaign for President
